intro: Orthosiphon robustus, commonly known as Java tea or Malabar mint, is a perennial herb native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Lamiaceae, characterized by its square stems and aromatic leaves. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–100 cm and features opposite, ovate to lanceolate leaves with serrated edges. Its small, tubular flowers are usually pale purple or white, arranged in whorled clusters. The leaves and stems are often used in traditional medicine for their purported diuretic and anti-inflammatory properties.
